column2: Chaos Knights are a sight to behold on the battlefield. Mutants, madmen, and freaks, they fear no enemy, for they have their god's watchful eyes upon them! They thunder into battle and ruthlessly destroy anything that gets in their way.
Here are where the Chaos marauders gather. Having spent their entire lives on the saddle, they are fearsome horsemen and terrible foes to behold.

The Chaos Wastes are constantly changing, sometimes on the whims of the dark gods, and so the tribes of the north must be ready to move south to survive. These warriors are hardened by the cold north wind, and are fast on their horses, running down anybody that would flee from them.
While the Hung steppe requires horsemanship to survive, Kurgan lands are less flat and full of rough terrain, making horse combat less dominating, but still important.

In steppe society, horses are everything, a status symbol for those who possess them. These troops are peasants, unable to afford a horse and thrust into battle as ranged support or meat for the grinder.

Due to the nature of the Chaos Wastes, tribes must be mobile in order to avoid being swallowed whole by the unpredictable threats that sometimes tear into reality. Simple yet effective, these yurts are where the rulers of the north dwell.

Great mammoths wander the frozen tundras of Norsca and the Chaos Wastes. These beasts are living mountains, enduring predators and foul weather with their thick fur and hide. The tribesmen living in the north often capture young mammoth calves to train them for war, and ride these fearsome creatures into battle with ramshackle towers on their backs.

Great mammoths wander the frozen tundras of Norsca and the Chaos Wastes. These beasts are living mountains, enduring predators and foul weather with their thick fur and hide. The tribesmen living in the north often capture young mammoth calves to train them for war, and ride these fearsome creatures into battle with ramshackle towers on their backs.
Here is where the Norscan Oathsworn reside, clad in heavy armour and extravagant furs, ever eager for blood and battle.
While the soft men of the south are begrudgingly raised in feudal fashion in service of their lord, freemen gather here in their own accord, seeking fame, adventure, or even favour from the gods.

It's a hard life in the cold north, having to fight all your life only to die a nobody, but these men have risen beyond that. Now they serve their lord proudly and boldly, for they know that failure means death and dishonor.
Norscans are not known to field cavalry, instead relying upon mercenaries from their more northerly brethren to fill the gaps.
Fabled Norscan Reavers gather here in between long ventures to distant lands. They arrive in port with holds full of trade goods, slaves, treasures and relics obtained from around the world.
A small Norscan hold, it is little more than a fortified longhouse and a small garrison.
A much larger hold, a network of walls, towers and other fortifications have sprung up about it.
Norscan Keeps are what the Imperials would begin to consider a start for civilisation, towering over much of the village that has formed around it.
A further expansion of the original keep, this is a fully-fledged castle with proper walls, watchtowers, a ready garrison and a small community inside dedicated to its service.
The ultimate expression of Norscan power in the region, full of soldiery, minor nobles, and enough food to last for months.
The Norscan Stronghold is a sight to behold, built of stone and metal, it would take a generous amount of soldiers to storm and successfully capture this castle.
Steel and iron-clad warriors gather here, preparing for their next battle in the name of their dark gods.
Built with steady, experienced hands and the finest timber from ancient forests, Norscan vessels able to go toe-to-toe with even Arabyan corsairs.
Here is where the Chaos Waste's finest soldiers are bred, trained, and readied for war. They are clad in the finest armour, armed to the teeth and ready to die for their gods.
Dwarf stone and dwarf arms guard the heart of the fortress.
Dwarf stone and dwarf arms guard the heart of the fortress.
A strong bulwark against the outside world provides the first line of dwarf defences.
Great smelting furnaces and casting moulds allow for the production of the legendary dwarf cannons.
A manufacturing centre attracts artisans and merchants.
Exploratory mine shafts provide small amounts of valuable metal ores and stone.
Quarrellers practice their aim at this firing range.
A shrine to the ancestors is a necessity for any dwarf hold.
The lands around the hold are suitable for sprawling farms, interspersed with villages and manors.
The hot, dry lands are hard to work, but those with the right techniques can prosper.
The cold, fierce lands of the north bring hard winters and short summers, but breed equally tough people.
The forbidding woodlands are not as safe as one would like, but logging, hunting and farming can be very productive.

The rocky heights and cliffs make for good defensive terrain, and naturally lead to mining and quarrying. Although not nearly as effective as Dwarf techniques, a good amount of ores, gemstones and fine building stone can be extracted.
This great city has densely packed streets and sprawling satellite communities.
The wide, open lands make for poor crops, but great numbers of horses and ponies can be raised for industry or war.

A small town is allowed to form around the castle, encompassed by curtain walls. The increased population and sprawl makes the castle harder to hold in a siege, but the settlement provides additional tax income and levies.
A port suitable for docking a great many ships is built, allowing for greater trade and the transport of troops.
Strong stone keeps protected by towers and walls are used by most Human civilisations in the world.
The castle is dedicated to resisting attacks with strong walls and a solid garrison.
A large house for the lord and his servants, protected by an small wall and a great many loyal warriors.
The hold is reinforced to resist attack.
Small villages are encouraged to be built around the main holding.
Halflings rarely go to war, but preparations are made nonetheless. The sheriff's office is also used to store weapons, house fighters, and train militia.
Even if there aren't any dedicated fighters about, one can always find Halflings ready to defend their homes.
Sharp-eyed Halflings are recruited and trained as scouts and guards. Specialising in archery, some brave Halflings also learn to ride ponies into battle, called Hobilars.

Rather than forcing Halflings into long, brunchless days of training, it is possible to simply drag as many as possible from their homes at the time of crisis. The effect of a great many angry, hungry Halflings defending their dinners are not to be underestimated.
The settlement was chosen as rally point for Imperial Army.
A garrison of household troops helps protect the castle and fight in the field. Proper Imperial fashion tends to favour a strong army of infantry, with supporting artillery and cavalry.
There are stables of a knightly order in this settlement. Orders both secular and religious provide Imperial army with armoured knights.
A garrison of household troops helps protect the castle and fight in the field. Proper Imperial fashion tends to favour a strong army of infantry, with supporting artillery and cavalry.
In the absence of proper infrastructure or trustworthy vassals, it can sometimes be necessary to levy the peasantry into service. Although poor in combat, it is better than nothing.

The local levy are combined with sellswords and adventurers, creating a cheap yet effective army that can be raised at a moments notice. The high proportion of 'former' bandits, pirates, and criminals means that the levies possess some skill and courage.

Core of any Empire army consists of professional soldiers which are trained and quartered for the service of their lord. Each Elector Count is expected to provide a Imperial Army with troops. Lower rank nobles posses limited amount of professional troops.

In exchange for generous landed estates and legal privileges, the minor nobility are required to volunteer their swords and lances when called upon. In addition to the typical peasant levy, a significant number of knights and squires form the core of the army, unmatched in training and equipment.

The peasants form the vast bulk of the army. While the majority are simply herded enmasse to the battle with whatever weapons they can find, the best and most trustworthy are provided with some training and equipment. Mounted yeomen are deployed as scouts and skirmishers, while stubborn men-at-arms are sent to anchor the infantry in place.
Across the Old World, the most commonly accepted deity is Shallya, mother of mercy. In harsh conditions and without a majority faith, a strong Shallyan presence strengthens the community.

In any sizeable community, there will be a number of competing faiths, usually in the same area. Although spiritual matters are usually outside the domain of the lord, it is always worth encouraging their worthwhile endeavours and reining in the less so.
A chapter house for knightly orders is opened. While most orders keep their own premises, itinerant knights, adventurers and penniless crusaders will find the basic services quite welcome.
A grand mausoleum for storing the remains and artifacts of the famous dead is built, creating a kind of possessive fervour among the resident zealots and attracting a number of pilgrims.
A great temple devoted to the veneration of Sigmar is built.

A small collection of books are kept in the castle for the enjoyment of the family and their esteemed guests. They are mostly historical and theological in nature, although there are some purely fictional works and essays on practical subjects.
The library is enhanced by the presence of a dedicated scribe. This fellow spends all his time copying texts with exact accuracy, which are then sold or exchanged for other books.

The library has grown in musty size, presenting a impressive body of knowledge and risk of fire. A number of rare and valuable works have been obtained at great cost, protected by a small team of clerks and scribes.
Scholars now occasionally request access to the library, seeking to use your resources for their research. One can find a text on almost any subject, provided you can get directions!

The library is an impressive edifice of civilisation. There are more books than anyone could read in a lifetime, and there are rumours of a lost colony of scribes that inhabit the dark recesses at the back.

The courtyard and outbuildings are dominated by various workshops and warehouses. The castle is kept well-stocked with provisions, and the resident specialists keep the garrison's equipment in fine condition.
A twisted shrine to Chaos. The masses come to venerate the Dark Gods and receive their blessings.
The keep gains a shrine to Sigmar, patron of the Mankind and the Empire. The appearance of an observant and pious liege is enough to inspire some minor moral improvements in the locals.

Wandering knights and pilgrims are lodged here, if only to prevent them from being a nuisance elsewhere. When battle is called, they eagerly join the greater host for a chance to gain glory and honour.
A temple of Shallya provides some mercy.
A slave trader is present in the settlement.
A slaver camp has formed around tribe seat, buying and selling slaves.
A slave market has formed around tribe seat, buying and selling slaves.
A Great Slave market  has formed around tribe seat, buying and selling slaves.
Tribe keeps a number of scouting parties patrolling their territory looking for the danger.
A Barracks for kossar pulks recruited from nearby stanitsas.
The neighbouring stanitsas hold ancient traditions of Gospodar tribes and fight from horseback as winged lancers.
The people of the neighbouring stanitsas provides this castle with rotas of winged lancers.
The Ungol influences in neighbouring stanitsas are strong. The people here tend to fight in Ungol style as horse archers.
The people of the neighbouring stanitsas provides this castle with bands of horse archers.
Magical walls made of solid ice were raised in this settlement. They provide additional defence and are a visible proof of the power of the Ice Magic.

The military engineers of Cathay are known to produce some of the finest weapons of war, where the equally skilled marksmen can equipped with them. Here they can practice with their powerful and renown repeating arbalests.

Tlanqua has survived isolated from the inland Lizardmen outposts of the Southlands. Many generations of fierce Skink Priests strenously defended its ruined borders from the younger species during the course of the ages, successfully repelling hordes of Beastmen, Greenskins, Undead and Humans.

Sudenburg is one of the richest merchant cities of the Southlands and the only colony of Old Worlders that survived the backlash of the Bretonnian Crusades. Once a cosmopolitan meeting point of the different Arabyan, Southlander and Westerlander cultures, it has turned into a full Sigmarite city after the machinations of the Mahtmasi nearly caused its destruction.

The Graf of Sudenburg granted the temple of Samur to the Knight-Captain who saved his city from the Mahtmasi's spells and prevented a war against the city-states of Olohrad and Al-Anaim in the XIX century. Since then, the Witch Hunters have been a constant presence in Sudenburg, keeping in check the influence of the undead lurking in the swamps around it.
What are you looking at-at? This nest was meant to be small and with little Clanrats, yes-yes! It's all part of the most illustrious commander's cunning sneaky plan-plan!
This nest is big, yes-yes, not too much that the Great Leader doesn't know the insignificant names of all the useless Clanrats inside it, no-no. He wants to keep everyone under his grasp-grasp!
A Skaven undercity, bigger, better and filler than any stupid manthing city on the surface. Plenty of Clanrats to go around, all most loyal-scared under the Great Leader's command, yes-yes!
A Skaven undercity, bigger, better and filler than any stupid manthing city on the surface. Plenty of Clanrats to go around, all most loyal-scared under the Great Leader's command, yes-yes!
O mighty Leader! The greatest of the Skaven cities is beneath you! Swarms of most loyal most vicious Clanrats await for your command, o Exalted One!

O mighty Leader! The greatest of the Skaven cities is beneath you! Swarms of most loyal most vicious Clanrats await for your command, o Exalted One! Your endless hordes are ready to overflow the surface and bring forth-forth your undeniable and most glorious victory!
The Underways are most ingenious masterwork of Skaven builders, yes-yes! Stupid manthings are too big and dumb-dumb to pass through!

The Underways are most ingenious masterwork of Skaven builders, yes-yes! Stupid manthings are too big and dumb-dumb to pass through! Many paths take care of greenthings too, stupid greenthings, cannot travel-search a maze-maze!

The Underways are most ingenious masterwork of Skaven builders, yes-yes! Stupid manthings are too big and dumb-dumb to pass through! Many paths take care of greenthings too, stupid greenthings, cannot travel-search a maze-maze! And smaller Underways keep dwarfthings out-slow best, trap their plump arms and furry beards in hook-hooks, cut-slash and kill-kill!

The Underways are most ingenious masterwork of Skaven builders, yes-yes! Stupid manthings are too big and dumb-dumb to pass through! Many paths take care of greenthings too, stupid greenthings, cannot travel-search a maze-maze! And smaller Underways keep dwarfthings out-slow best, trap their plump arms and furry beards in hook-hooks, cut-slash and kill-kill! With more pits and traps-traps, secret tunnels and covered traps, nothing less than Skaven is sure to pass, yes-yes!

The Underways are most ingenious masterwork of Skaven builders, yes-yes! Stupid manthings are too big and dumb-dumb to pass through! Many paths take care of greenthings too, stupid greenthings, cannot travel-search a maze-maze! And smaller Underways keep dwarfthings out-slow best, trap their plump arms and furry beards in hook-hooks, cut-slash and kill-kill! With more pits and traps-traps, secret tunnels and covered traps, nothing less than Skaven is sure to pass, yes-yes! ...Hm.. o Great Leader! Where are we?

Most fortunate and powerful leader! A great deal of precious-dumb Breeders have been stocked for you here-here. Tame-cut eunuchs keep good-well care of them while you plant new hordes of vicious and most excellent Stormvermins in their belly.
Even Bigger Stormvermin Big Shouty Barrack-Thing
A big hole to give the Stormvermin a place to fight each other without picking on the lurid useless brown Skaven. They need to EARN that-that.
Grow big rats to loose upon manthings and maim-kill them! Don't let them eat them all, though! Clanrats need to eat some manthing meat too!
Night Runners Big Shady Sneaky Cove
Night Runners Big Shady Super-Sneaky Cove
There's darker deeper places to hide the shadowy night runners, yes-yes! Only there they can learn how to be super-sneaky and catch off-guard the stupid night-blind manthings!
The holiest monks of our good Lord of Decay hide-hide here to bring much praise and solemn pestilential tributes to the great and powerful Horned Rat.
Gutter Runners Big Shady Sneaky Cove
Gutter Runners Big Shady Super-Sneaky Cove

Gutter Runners are the smartest most cunning killers of the powerful Clan Eshin, short-short of the sneaky-smart Assassins, of course! They need a dark-dark place-nest to best hone their skill-skills and be of use to you, o Great Leader!

The bearers of the most precious gifts of decay of the most holy Horned Rat dwell here to hide-wrap them in their spinning maces, then they charge and spread them upon the enemies of the Skaven Underempire!

The most vicious and greatly-well marketed bioengineering creation of the wisest Master Moulders lie here, awaiting for your commands, Great General! Under your smartest guide, the Rat Ogres shall bring fear-pain to the pitiful armies of the manthings and such-such!

The Poisoned Wind Globadiers need a lot of chemicals and much work-work to create their deadly Skryre-approved weapons. Once ready, they shall rain unescapable death-death upon your wretched and stupid enemies, o Great Leader! Better yet-yet if they are stupid dwarfthings, holed up and choking in their own filthy tunnel-nests!

It takes sometime to get jezzails in place, but when they do-do, they can shoot-kill anything on their way from much farther than anything else, so you can keep them as behind as yourself, most bravest Commander!
The bell rings-rings! And with its sacred and creepy sound, it brings forth the coming age of the triumphant Skaven! The Horned Rat is with us! Charge-charge kill-kill!

The Lord of Decays have brought forth gifts of every kind-kind for all those who truly know the nature of the Horned Rat. In this boiling cauldron of plagues, we shall worship-serve our great and only master!
Many More Triangle Tolls Endless Swarms
Triangles, Triangles! Pay the toll to the Horned Rat, draw and build-make more triangles to honor his dreaded name-name! TRIANGLES!!

The greatest minds of the most ingenious warlock-engineers of the exalted Clan Skryre will make good use-work of this great and sparkly laboratory to build new and terrible warmachines for you to employ, o Great Leader!

The greatest minds of the most ingenious warlock-engineers of the exalted Clan Skryre will make good use-work of this great and sparkly laboratory to build new and terrible warmachines for you to employ, o Great Leader!
In the genetic-engineering pits of interbreeding are the wondrous pools from which our great and cunning Master Moulders will create new twisted horrors to unleash upon your enemies, o Great Leader!
In the genetic-engineering pits of interbreeding are the wondrous pools from which our great and cunning Master Moulders will create new twisted horrors to unleash upon your enemies, o Great Leader!

In this hallowed grounds the Horned Rat has blessed the very rocks with his venefic presence. We've thus built a great temple in his honor, hosting many plague monks and verminlords to appease his neverending hunger for ruin and devastation!

In this hallowed grounds the Horned Rat has blessed the very rocks with his venefic presence. We've thus built a great temple in his honor, hosting many plague monks and verminlords to appease his neverending hunger for ruin and devastation!

The sneakiest and most cunning Assassins are trained here-here, searching for new and most inventive ways of maim-killing surface-dwelling things-things, yes-yes! Within these halls-halls, new murderlords will be born, to be employed under your exquisite services, o mighty leader!

The sneakiest and most cunning Assassins are trained here-here, searching for new and most inventive ways of maim-killing surface-dwelling things-things, yes-yes! Within these halls-halls, new murderlords will be born, to be employed under your exquisite services, o mighty leader!
Oh, Most Magnificent and Exalted, Cunning and Powerful, Smartest and Handsomest Skaven of all times, this great and prestigious monument honors you and you alone, in all your Great-Greatness!

Dig a hole and fill it with slave-slaves, you worthless minions! Yes-yes, slaves are pitiful, but in big stocks are worth something to the Moulders and Warlock-Engineers, to fuel their machinery and serve as experiment-fodder, great money and warpstone for you, yes-yes!
Put our great biogenetical monstrosities into a pit fight, yes-yes! The winner comes out even stronger, fact-fact! More ready-fierce to fight-fight for you, Great Leader!

Skaven are the race of the future! Does any surface thing know-know how to harness the power of warpstone to make Skaven talk from afar at the cost of only a few stupid-dead slave-slaves? Of course not!

Choo-choo-choo! The great minds of Clan Skryre need no horse-thing or gyro-thing or tunnel-digger to move fastest and quickest than any surface thing! They can build long metal rails, to connect all the Underempire and make-lead huge armies of Clanrats through it in moments, flashing with their proof-patented warptrains!
The great capital of Skavendom, where the Council of Thirteen takes seats, great factories spew much smog and tecnology and the dreaded bells never stop ringing!
We-we know how to proper train some black Skaven to be vicious and cunning and smart and stuff!
A place to find-seek new gifts of the Horned Rat, spread the plagues, cripple-kill manthings above!
A great place to concoct and mix-mix new philters and poisons for all of an assassins precious needs-needs.
New mixes to be tested, new breeds to spawn into existance, for the glory of Clan Moulder!
Distill the purestest warpstone, fill big guns with it and destroy your enemies, yes-yes! The Clan Skryre must be given space to test and refine the most precious mineral of all world.
A tiny hole to fill with slaves and squeeze warpstone from.
More tunnels, more slaves, but this mine is still barely fulfilling your greatest needs, o Mighty Leader!
This warpmine doesn't just have useless slaves to work in, it has the great and excellent machines!
This mine has been dug deeper and deeper, the tunnels reinforced and extended to squeeze as much warpstone as possible.
Many slaves die each day in the dark abysses of this warpmine, but the results are more than worth it!
Countless slaves die each day in the dark abysses of this warpmine and plenty of machines twist and melt under the changing forces of the precious mineral, but the results are more than worth it!
